page.title: 19DERELICTION IN TWICKENHAM
page.content: There are many derelict buildings in Twickenham, but two of the most famous are the{Odeon Cinema}and {Twickenham Swimming Baths. Once Twickenham Pool was a hive of activity with a big cafe, two pools and a diving board.Nowadays weeds grow between the paving stones and graffiti lines the pool instead of water. Now instead of towels and sunbathers around the edge of the pool, broken bottles, old tyres and rubbish have taken their place. The Odeon Cinema, originally the Luxor, was opened on November 18th. 1929 at the junction of Heath Road and Cross Deep. It was then converted into a theatre and then back to a cinema before becoming derelict in 1979. Apart from being a lovely piece of architecture, it is one of the biggest derelict buildings in the area.
